palladium:compound.name: Compound Icon
palladium:compound.description: Let's you merge multiple icons into one.

settings.name: icons
settings.description: Array of the icons you want to merge

palladium:experience.name: Experience Icon
palladium:experience.description: Displays an experience amount as an icon.

settings.name: amount
settings.description: Amount of experience points/level

settings.name: level
settings.description: Determines if icon should display level or not

palladium:ingredient.name: Ingredient Icon
palladium:ingredient.description: Circles through the items of an ingredient.

settings.name: ingredient
settings.description: Ingredient for the item

palladium:item.name: Item Icon
palladium:item.description: Uses an item as an icon.

settings.name: item
settings.description: ID of the item that's supposed to be displayed. If you leave it out, it will display the item from the current context (if given).

palladium:item_in_slot.name: Item in Slot Icon
palladium:item_in_slot.description: Uses the item that's in the specified slot.

settings.name: slot
settings.description: Name of the slot.

palladium:texture.name: Textured Icon
palladium:texture.description: Uses a texture to render as an icon.

settings.name: texture
settings.description: Path to the texture file or dynamic texture json file.

settings.name: tint
settings.description: Adds an additional tint to the texture.

palladium:default.name: Default Item
palladium:default.description: Default Item Type, you don't need to specify that you want this one, leaving 'type' out of the json will make it fall back to this one.

settings.name: block
settings.description: ID of the block that this item is for

settings.name: slot
settings.description: The slot the item will fit in. Possible values: [helmet, chestplate, leggings, boots]

settings.name: armor_material
settings.description: Armor material, which defines certain characteristics about the armor. Open armor_materials.html for seeing how to make custom ones. Possible values: [minecraft:diamond, minecraft:gold, minecraft:leather, minecraft:turtle, minecraft:chainmail, minecraft:iron, minecraft:netherite]

settings.name: armor_renderer
settings.description: Location of the armor renderer file. Doesn't need to be specified, it will automatically look for one in a path corresponding to the item's ID: A 'test:item' will look for the armor renderer file at 'assets/test/palladium/armor_renderers/item.json'.

settings.name: openable
settings.description: Marks the armor piece as openable.

settings.name: opening_time
settings.description: Determines the time the item needs for it to be fully opened. Leave at 0 for instant. Needs 'openable' to be enabled to take effect.

settings.name: opened_sound
settings.description: Sound that is played when the suit has been fully opened.

settings.name: closed_sound
settings.description: Sound that is played when the suit has been fully closed.

settings.name: opening_toggle_sound
settings.description: Sound that is played when opening button has been pressed.

settings.name: tier
settings.description: Tool tier, which defines certain characteristics about the tool. Open tool_tiers.html for seeing how to make custom ones. Possible values: [minecraft:diamond, minecraft:gold, minecraft:stone, minecraft:wood, minecraft:iron, minecraft:netherite]

settings.name: base_damage
settings.description: Base value for the damage. For reference: swords usually have 3

settings.name: attack_speed
settings.description: Base value for the attack speed. For reference: swords usually have -2.4

settings.name: tier
settings.description: Tool tier, which defines certain characteristics about the tool. Open tool_tiers.html for seeing how to make custom ones. Possible values: [minecraft:diamond, minecraft:gold, minecraft:stone, minecraft:wood, minecraft:iron, minecraft:netherite]

settings.name: base_damage
settings.description: Base value for the damage. For reference: pickaxes usually have 1

settings.name: attack_speed

settings.name: base_damage
settings.description: Base value for the damage. For reference: shovels usually have 1.5

settings.name: attack_speed

settings.name: use_duration
settings.description: Amount of ticks the shield can be actively held for

settings.name: repair_ingredient
settings.description: The ingredient needed to repair the shield in an anvil. Can be null for making it non-repairable

settings.name: velocity
settings.description: Velocity multiplier for the shot projectile

settings.name: inaccuracy
settings.description: Inaccuracy for the shot projectile

settings.name: use_duration
settings.description: Amount of ticks the bow can be used for

settings.name: projectiles
settings.description: Item tag which contains all items that can be shot. By default all Minecraft arrows

settings.name: held_projectiles
settings.description: Item tag which contains all items that can be shot by being in the off hand. Can be left out to fallback to the 'projectiles' option

settings.name: velocity_multiplier
settings.description: Velocity multiplier for the shot projectile, works differently to the bow one.

settings.name: inaccuracy
settings.description: Inaccuracy for the shot projectile

settings.name: use_duration
settings.description: Amount of ticks the bow can be used for

settings.name: projectiles
settings.description: Item tag which contains all items that can be shot. By default all Minecraft arrows

settings.name: held_projectiles
settings.description: Item tag which contains all items that can be shot by being in the off hand. Can be left out to fallback to the 'projectiles' option

settings.name: capacity
settings.description: Max amount of energy the item can hold

settings.name: max_input
settings.description: Maximum amount of energy the item can be inserted with during one insertion. Using 0 makes the item not accept any energy

settings.name: max_output
settings.description: Maximum amount of energy the item can extract with during one withdrawal. Using 0 makes the item not extract any energy

palladium:projectile.name: Projectile Item
palladium:projectile.description: If added to the item tag for a bow or a crossbow, this item type can used as ammunitation to shoot pre-defined projectiles.

settings.name: entity_type
settings.description: ID of the entity type that should be shot. Only projectile entity works, like arrows, snowballs, or Palladium's custom projectile

settings.name: entity_data
settings.description: Custom NBT data for the shot entity

palladium:after_image.name: After Image Trail
palladium:after_image.description: Spawns copies of you as a trail.

settings.name: color
settings.description: Determines the tint/color of the after image

settings.name: mimic_player
settings.description: If enabled, the after image will copy the player's skin and armor

settings.name: spacing
settings.description: Determines the space between two trail segments

settings.name: lifetime
settings.description: Determines how long one trail segment stays alive (in ticks)

settings.name: opacity
settings.description: Determines the (initial) opacity of the after image.

palladium:compound.name: Compound
palladium:compound.description: Can be used to merge multiple trails into one file.

settings.name: trails
settings.description: Can be used to merge multiple trails into one file. Simply declare them in this array

palladium:gradient.name: Gradient Trail
palladium:gradient.description: Renders a simple, colored gradient trail.

settings.description: Determines the tint/color of the gradient

settings.name: spacing
settings.description: Determines the space between two trail segments

settings.name: lifetime
settings.description: Determines how long one trail segment stays alive (in ticks)

settings.name: opacity
settings.description: Determines the (initial) opacity of the after image.

settings.name: normal_transparency
settings.description: Can be turned on if you want to make a gradient black.

settings.name: lifetime

settings.name: amount

settings.name: spread_x
settings.description: Determines the spread of a lightning position relative to the player on the X/horizontal axis. 1 means across the normal player hitbox, 0 means always in the middle.

settings.name: spread_y
settings.description: Determines the spread of a lightning position relative to the player on the Y/vertical axis. 1 means across the normal player hitbox, 0 means always in the middle.
